body: 3 exclusive products will be launched across 7-Eleven’s local stores on 10 July in conjunction with Singapore Food Festival. The products are new ready-to-eat fusion products that highlight local flavours. Namely, Chicken Satay Onigiri, Salted Egg Tamagoyaki and Takoyaki with Chilli Crab Sauce and Egg Mayo.

body: Advance Dining is a curated dining experience led by artist collective duo Aiwei Foo & Wangxian Tan. An exclusive site-specific curated dining experience that focuses on the key elements of food. It focuses on the key elements of gastronomy to subvert food norms and dining standards.
eventOrganizer: Telok Ayer Arts Club x The Picnic
name: Advanced Dining
description: Advanced Dining is organised in conjunction with the Singapore Food Festival 2019!

body: The Affordable Art Fair, the leading showcase for affordable contemporary art, returns from 22 – 24 November 2019. All set to turn the city pink for its tenth Autumn Edition, the fair will be offering a fresh plethora of local, regional and international talents featuring 80 galleries. To be held at the F1 Pit Building, the Affordable Art Fair will showcase a wide range of contemporary art all priced below $15,000 with 75% of the art offered at under $7,500. Offering hands on advice, and educational guidance to all newbie art lovers as well as established art collectors; the Affordable Art Fair is defined by making art accessible and as welcoming as possible, and ensuring that everyone can fall in love with art.
name: Affordable Art Fair
description: The leading showcase for affordable contemporary art.

companyDisplayName: BASE ENTERTAINMENT MARINA BAY SUB PTE. LTD.
body:
From the producer of The Lion King, the beloved story of Aladdin comes to life in this spectacular new musical. Breathtaking sets, mind-blowing special effects, over 300 lavish costumes and a fabulous cast bring the magic of Disney’s Aladdin to life on stage. Featuring all the songs from the classic Academy award winning film, including “Friend like Me”, “A Whole New World” and “Arabian Nights”, prepare to experience the unmissable theatrical magic that is Aladdin.

Aladdin opens for its only stop in Asia in Singapore on 21 July at the Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands.
source: BASE ENTERTAINMENT MARINA BAY SUB PTE. LTD.
name: Aladdin
description: The Hit Broadway Musical

body:
Awakenings: Art in Society in Asia 1960s-1990s is a large-scale exhibition of modern and contemporary Asian art that examines how artists radically sought experimentation and change in art and society during this turbulent period. Co-curated by National Gallery Singapore, National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Korea, and The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo, with the support of the Japan Foundation Asia Centre, this exhibition features around 150 key works by leading artists from 12 Asian countries. Awakenings traces significant moments across the region when artists provoked new ways of thinking about and making art, critically engaging with major events such as the Cold War, the Vietnam War, independence and democratic movements, and globalisation.


Curators: Seng Yu Jin, Adele Tan, Charmaine Toh, Cheng Jiayun
price: $20 (General admission) | FREE for Singaporeans and PRs
name: AWAKENINGS: ART IN SOCIETY IN ASIA 1960s TO 1990s
description: "Awakenings: Art in Society in Asia 1960s-1990s" is a large-scale exhibition of modern and contemporary Asian art that examines how artists radically sought experimentation and change in art and society during this turbulent period.

body:
Make your very own Chinese Coin knot bracelet! Match to your outfit with the right colors and material, or gift them to your loved ones.

< What you will learn >

At this 2-hour, workshop, you will learn to tie the Chinese Coin knot and understand the technique of adjusting the knots. You will learn how to make your own Coin knot bracelet using traditional knotting cord.

< What you will bring home >

A Chinese Coin knot bracelet.

< Pre-requisites >

Our workshops are suitable for beginners and those with some experience with knotting. You must be able to tie simple ribbons or your shoe laces. Age is not a barrier, but children under 10 years old must be accompanied by an adult. Those with Special Needs are welcomed to learn alongside the other participants. Or send me an email at [wearable.craft@gmail.com] to arrange for a separate session.
name: Chinese knots - Conventional handicraft unconventional designs
description: Learn to create unique Chinese knots accessories. Come experience a revolution in traditions and learn about innovative ways to use knots.

body:
The City Hall, formerly known as Municipal Building, has had a long and colourful history since its completion in 1929. The building was constructed to house the Municipal Council and its various departments, and later occupied by Japanese authorities during World War II, as well as post-independence government and ministry offices. Today, the City Hall forms one wing of National Gallery Singapore.

In City Hall: A Place for the People, audiences can look forward to an immersive multimedia experience that combines art with stories inspired by key events that took place within the grand City Hall Chamber. The exhibition runs from August 2019 through to August 2021, as part of the Singapore Bicentennial commemoration.


Curator: Suenne Megan Tan
name: CITY HALL: IF WALLS COULD TALK
description: Look forward to an immersive multimedia experience that combines art with stories inspired by key events that took place within the grand City Hall Chamber.

body:
Travel back thousands of years to the Cretaceous period, and solve the ancient mystery of the elusive polar dinosaurs of Australia! Curated by one of the world’s leading palaeontologists, Emerita Professor Patricia Vickers-Rich, DinoQuest will make its official world premiere debut in Singapore and unleash a series of real-life Dinosaur Scientist Adventure activities! This blockbuster exhibition promises an immersive experience through a series of activities powered by RFID tracking technology as well as the latest multimedia technology that will span across 7 zones. Get ready to be a palaeontologist for a day where you get to discover and name your very own dinosaur!


Separate admission charge to Science Centre Singapore applies.


Check out what's in store at Science Centre Singapore today!


FACE YOUR FEAR AT PHOBIA²: THE SCIENCE OF FEAR


Before the age of modern medicine, coffins often had a bell-rigged device above-ground. Should a person be mistakenly buried alive, this device would alert mourners of their ghastly plight! Embark on a journey of self-discovery and explore the topic of fear, from its historical and cultural significance, to the psychology and physiology of fear and how it affects our daily lives at Science Centre Singapore’s latest exhibition – Phobia²: The Science of Fear. Be prepared for something different and perhaps learn to better manage your own fears! Photo-opportunities abound, too!


EXPLORE ASIA’S LARGEST MIRROR MAZE


Filled with infinite reflections and endless hallways, Professor Crackitt’s Light Fantastic exhibition is here to test your navigation skills! Can you find your way through the identical corridors that seem to loop back confusingly on themselves? As you stop to re-orientate yourself on your journey, be sure to check out the Professor’s numerous whimsical inventions.


FLY WITH THE BUTTERFLIES


Go on an immersive journey through the stages of butterfly metamorphosis at Singapore’s first indoor butterfly sanctuary. Encounter beautiful butterflies* from Singapore and around the region!

*The number of butterflies and species vary depending on the season.


CHECK OUT THE ZOETROPE SPINS


Standing at 1.5-metre-tall, watch the Giant Zoetrope spins and comes to life! Once the zoetrope starts to spin and the strobe lights flash, our brain is ‘tricked’ into interpreting the 3D individual static images as a single moving image, bringing the zoetrope to come to life before our own eyes!


FUN TIME FOR THE LITTLE ONE AT KIDSSTOP


Check out the first children’s Science Centre in Singapore! With specially themed exhibition zones, hands-on activities and fun-filled programmes in a exclusively dedicated 3,500sqm fun space, KidsSTOP™ is where children aged 18 months to 8 years can learn about science and the world around them through meaningful play. Let them Imagine, Discover, Experience and Dream! Great place to bond too, at this wonderfully designed science activity centre!


BLAST OFF TO SPACE AT OMNI-THEATRE


Enjoy an out-of-the-world movie-going experience at Southeast Asia’s first 8K 3D Digital Dome Theatre! Join our Science Educators as they take you on an experiential journey to remote locations on Earth and in space in this 221-seat theatre via a range of digital movies and live planetarium shows. A truly immersive experience!


EXPERIENCE WINTER AT SNOW CITY


Escape the scorching tropical heat and immerse yourself in sub-zero temperature at Snow City! From building a snowman to whizzing down our three-storey-high snow slope, it’s fun, fun and more fun here at the coolest playground in Singapore! Don't forget to drift on ice at Singapore's coldest bumper car arena too!


Find out more about our exhibitions and attractions at www.science.edu.sg.

#ScienceCentreSG #DinoQuestSG #ButterfliesUpClose #OmniTheatre #KidsSTOPSG #SnowCitySG
name: Embark on An Epic Adventure to the Cretaceous Period at DinoQuest!
description: Catch the World Premiere of DinoQuest Exhibition at Science Centre Singapore

body:
From Singapore to Singaporean: The Bicentennial Experience brings to life Singapore’s momentous evolution from 1299, shaped by wider regional and global shifts. It comprises an immersive, ticketed experience within the Fort Canning Centre, and a free and easy exploration through pavilions within the greenery of Fort Gate.

Time Traveller
Enjoy a front-row view of Singapore’s 700-year history. Experience first-hand the sights, sounds and drama of formative events throughout our evolution. This segment requires a ticket for entry. It is a timed experience that will last 60 minutes. (Show Advisory: There will be strobe lights and loud sounds. Recommended for children aged 5 and above.)

Pathfinder
The Pathfinder is a series of pavilions where we experience our 700-year old history through space. It takes the visitor through Singapore’s place in the world across the centuries by using artefacts, maps, flora and the written word. This is a free and easy exploration which will take approximately 30 minutes or more.
name: From Singapore to Singaporean: The Bicentennial Experience
description: As the centrepiece event of the Singapore Bicentennial, this multimedia sensory experience brings you back in time to witness key moments in Singapore’s transformation from as far back as 1299.

body:
29 – 31 August 2019 | 8.30pm | 9.45pm | 11pm

Duration: 30 minutes

Ticketing Details: Tickets available at https://www.sistic.com.sg/events/csnf2019

Having performed to more than 6 million spectators in sold-out shows across 34 countries and 58 cities, here is your chance to see the internationally renowned Fuerza Bruta take Singapore by storm as the Argentinean troupe performs at the Singapore Night Festival.

Look forward to a 360-degree sensory theatre party spectacle performed over and around a standing audience. Brace yourself for an adrenaline rush in this kinetic combination of high energy and action-packed aerial acrobatics performance. Let reality take a backseat as performers soar to the skies and pack in plenty of surprises with mind-blowing lighting visual effects just inches away from you. A show that sets one free from inhibitions and transcends language and conventional theatre, here’s your chance to fully immerse yourself and be brutally happy!
name: Fuerza Bruta - Singapore Night Festival 2019
description: Here is your chance to see the internationally renowned Fuerza Bruta take Singapore by storm as the Argentinean troupe performs at the Singapore Night Festival!

body:
Building onto the success of the first edition, Gallery Children’s Biennale 2019 will take on the theme of “Embrace”, with a wish to distill the spirit of inclusiveness and signal the genuine welcoming of children and families to take part in the promise of endless possibilities offered in art. The second edition, which runs from 25 May until 31 December, will feature interactive, hands-on and multimedia artworks created by Singaporean and Southeast Asian artists.

The Gallery Children’s Biennale aims to inspire the imagination of young minds with artistic experiences that transform a child’s understanding of the world around them. It also aims to increase the level of art and cultural appreciation amongst the people in Singapore, making the Gallery’s content accessible to the public beyond niche art experiences.

The first edition of the Gallery Children’s Biennale – “Dreams and Stories” was held in 2017 and it successfully attracted close to 300,000 visitors. It also garnered international interest that an adapted version is currently presented at Staatliche Kunstsammlungen Dresden (SKD), Germany from 22 Sep 2018 to 24 Feb 2019


Festival Director: Suenne Megan Tan
name: GALLERY CHILDREN’S BIENNALE 2019
description: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2019 will take on the theme of “Embrace”, with a wish to distill the spirit of inclusiveness and signal the genuine welcoming of children and families to take part in the promise of endless possibilities offered in art.

body:
The series of events happening in Kampong Glam from 5 to 14 July 2019 include: 

1. KG Home & Lifestyle Bazaar

The entire Baghdad street will be sheltered for a bazaar showcasing lifestyle merchants mainly from Kampong Glam. 

2. KG Souq 

There will be daily live music performances in a cozy garden setting at Sultan Gate Park from 6pm to 10pm. For full program lineup, check out OKG's instagram account @onekamponggelam. 

3. Gelam Gallery 

Visit Muscat Street for Singapore's first outdoor art gallery.
name: GSS: Experience Kampong Glam
description: In conjunction with Great Singapore Sales (GSS) this year, One Kampong Gelam (OKG) is organizing a series of events in Kampong Glam from 5 to 14 July 2019.

body: Singapore’s longest running annual sale (formerly known as The GSS for the past 25 years) is back as GSS: Experience Singapore! It’s more than just a sale - it’s a retail experience that entices locals and tourists alike to take home a slice of Singapore - to Shop, Dine, Play, Explore & Live It Up! The spotlight is on the Singapore Experience which celebrates our local talents. This includes up & comers in retail, F&B, art, design, as well as our world famous resorts and attractions. Not to mention the unique experiences of our cultural enclaves. Embark on a retail adventure which kicks off at the heart of the country’s retail oasis at Orchard Road, including a flurry of enriching activities at prominent cultural and historical hotspot Kampong Gelam.
name: GSS: Experience Singapore 2019
description: GSS: Experience Singapore 2019

body: The annual Hawker Spotlight, jointly hosted by City Gas and Singapore Tourism Board (STB), will run under the Singapore Food Festival umbrella for its fourth edition this year. This year’s showcase will be held at Golden Mile Food Centre, which houses famous hawker stalls that offer a variety of local dishes. At the end of the tour, all media attendees will be invited to sample the delectable spread of food and drinks from the featured hawker stalls.
name: Hawker Spotlight 2019
description: Hawker Spotlight is organised for the Singapore Food Festival annually.

body: The International Champions Cup is the world’s premier pre-season football tournament featuring the top football clubs in the world. After launching in 2013, the tournament has revolutionised the global pre-season window with consistent delivery of mouth-watering matches to fans around the world. It is now the undisputed dominant tournament force during the critical pre-season period. Since 2017, Singapore is the only South East Asian country to host a leg of the tournament in the region, with the 2019 tournament being the third edition held here. This year, the global format will be reprised with each club playing three matches in total with the overall standings determined on a points-based system, crowning one overall global winner.
name: International Champions Cup 2019 in Singapore
description: Premier pre-season football tournament featuring the world's top football clubs
